title: For Sale:  AR15, Mega Machine Shop lower & upper, carbine, free-floated, RELIABLE!
postcontent:
I built this AR15 myself using a Mega Machine Shop upper and lower and a DPMS Lower Parts Kit. It has a Wilson carbine-length (16.5") barrel, and is chrome-lined. The free-floated fore-end is Yankee Hill Machine YHM 9631 carbine-length lightweight, the front sight is also a YHM, the stock is an Ace Skeleton, and a Magpul winter trigger guard has been fitted.

I've had this rifle since 2004. I have fired somewhere north of 2000 rounds out of it (and I mean JUST north, not 5000 rounds north) and it has never failed to feed, fire or eject. Not once. I have shot my own handloads with this rifle at 100 yards into 0.7 inches, with iron sights to boot (and I have pics of the target to prove it). Scope is a Vortex Viper Ball-Plex 2-7 x 33, and is lifetime warranted. The scope is essentially new; I've fired perhaps 200 rounds with it and it's zeroed nicely.

It's simply an amazing, pinpoint-accurate rifle, and frankly, I don't want to sell it, but I need to pay for the last semester of grad school, so they're all headed out of my safe.

Comes with the pictured magazines.

Price is firm, and I'm not entertaining any offers or trades. Bring cash/postal money order or stay home. If you're in a state that frowns upon the ownership of these kinds of rifles, or you're unable to complete the transaction in any way because you won't pass background, or if you're waiting for another gun to sell, kindly don't call. CCW people will be smiled upon. All others bring drivers license and we will both take away a bill of sale. Shipping, if you're from out of state, will cost you $35 (lower 48) and I will insure the rifle, which will be delivered to your FFL via United States Postal Service. 

Nick REDACTED

title: For Trade:  AR15: Rock River Varminter 20" barrel, free-floated, Bill Springfield trigger, truly accurate
postcontent:
If you didn't want to wait the 14+ days of backlog for the Colorado Bureau of Investigation to complete the tens-of-thousands of background checks they've got going, try a perfectly-legal and safe face-to-face trade of a gun on Armslist.

I've had this Rock River AR15 for a couple of years now. I bought it used and was amazed at its accuracy with my handloads - I have seen this rifle shoot under 0.5" at 100 yards. I have put a Magpul Winter Trigger Guard and MOE handgrip on the rifle, and it's got a crisp Bill Springfield trigger job. I have free-floated the fore-end with a UTG free-float kit, which is sturdy as hell and nicely anodized.

The riflescope is a Falcon Menace 4-14 x 44mm, which is a pretty nice piece of kit for the money. 

This rifle has never failed to feed, fire or eject. I have put about 600 rounds through it and haven't seen the first hint of unreliability out of it. 

Rifle will come with the magazines pictured - 5 x 30-round magazines (three aluminum, three Orlite plastic mags), 2 x 20 round magazines (one steel, one Orlite), and 1 x 9 round magazine.

I am only interested in trading this rifle for any .308 AR, and I won't be selling it at any price. If you're in a state that frowns upon the ownership of these kinds of rifles, or you're unable to complete the transaction in any way because you won't pass background, or if you're waiting for another gun to sell, kindly don't call. CCW people will be smiled upon. All others bring drivers license and we will both take away a bill of sale. Shipping, if you're from out of state, will cost you $35 (lower 48) and I will insure the rifle, which will be delivered to your FFL via United States Postal Service. 

Nick REDACTED call or text

It has a M-4 profile barrel which has had the A-2 front sight post removed and a 13.7" Troy Battle Rail with a Troy low profile gas block installed by a local firearms dealer. title: For Sale:  Vector Arms V93, an American-made HK93 (w. Bill Springfield trigger!)
postcontent:
If you didn't want to wait the required 14+ days for the Colorado Bureau of Investigation to complete the tens-of-thousands of background checks they've got going, try a perfectly-legal and safe face-to-face purchase of a gun on Armslist.

Offered for sale is this perfect Vector Arms V-93 (a copy of the H&K V33/93). I have owned this rifle since 2007 and found it to be accurate, perfectly reliable and fun to shoot, with a mild recoil. Vector makes one hell of a gun - the welds are beautiful and the finish is flawless. They bought the tooling from H&K in Portugal, but the receiver is American-made (UTAH!) as are many other parts on the rifle.

Comes with bipod, two MKK clear polymer magazines, and one aluminum 40-round H&K mag, Brugger and Thomet (real, not some airsoft piece of crap) scope mount, and 2-7 x 33 Vortex Viper scope with Leupold rings.

For sale at $1750 with scope and mount, or $1575 without - either way you get the rear irons (not pictured). Price is firm, and I'm not entertaining any offers or trades. Bring cash/postal money order or stay home. If you're in a state that frowns upon the ownership of these kinds of rifles, or you're unable to complete the transaction in any way because you won't pass background, or if you're waiting for another gun to sell, kindly don't call. CCW people will be smiled upon. All others bring drivers license and we will both take away a bill of sale. Shipping, if you're from out of state, will cost you $35 (lower 48) and I will insure the rifle, which will be delivered to your FFL via United States Postal Service. 

Nick REDACTED call or text

title: For Sale:  "Custom AR"  Misleading/Buyer Beware
postcontent:
Don't think for one minute when the term "Custom AR" is used in a post that is justifies the cost at which they are asking.  There is nothing "CUSTOM" about assembling an AR-15.

Buyer Beware!!  I've seen a lot of junk out there that dishonest people are trying to sell to those who are desperate to buy an AR before some sort of Federal Gun Ban goes into effect.  There isn't a guarantee that it will even happen.

Think before you buy.  Ask plenty of question or read up on the internet blogs about certain items. 

Good Luck!

Happy Holidays

title: For Sale:  NEW SIG SAUER M400 Enhanced with Magpul stock
location: Idaho Falls, ID, Idaho Falls, Idaho
postcontent:
First and foremost let me explain what this auction is about.  I am raising money to support a campaign and to whoever helps me in that venture will be given the gun. I'm not just selling a gun here, I'm also including 800 rounds of ammo and 2 magazines, plus a SureFire flashlight, but more importantly I am asking one person that believes in the right to bare arms as strongly as I do, to support my efforts to change the minds of opinion leaders regarding the gun ban. If your just looking for a great deal on gun, then look elsewhere. If your one of the people out there that wants to screw the price down, or that actually thinks he/she will find these guns for less than $2000 then do it. Prices are going up like crazy folks, thats just the way it is.  And if you want this gun bad enough you will pay the price I ask, but know your helping to support the NRA and my efforts to change the minds of those in a position to influence gun laws in our country.  Please dont send me emails asking for the price to be dropped or to tell me you think I am ripping you off. I'm obviously charging more than going rate because its to raise money for the campaign. Think of it this way. I once wanted a book that was being advertised on a infomercial. The book was free with a $500 donation. That was the only way to get the book. Yup, I paid it and glad I did. I knew I helped support the cause being the man and got the book I wanted. Had I really just wanted the book, I'm sure I could have found it on Amazon for $20 or so... and if your in the same boat and just want the gun, then go elsewhere. But if you want to stand up for your Second Amendment and try to change the way things are going, then please donate to my cause and I will give you the gun and all the extras for free.

Ok, so what am I asking? I am asking someone donate $5000 to my venture. If you can not purchase though please make a small donation by emailing me directly for the paypal address. Even a few dollars may help tremendously. Folks, we are living in a crazy time right now. Now is when we need to speak up and let our voices be heard. Lets not let a cooked up hoax and our emotions get in the way of logical thinking.

This Del-Ton Dissipator A3 Flat-Top AR-15 Upper Receiver comes complete and fully assembled, ready for installation onto any mil-spec lower receiver. The Forged 7075 T6 Aluminum upper features a 16" Heavy Contour Barrel, F-Marked Front Sight Assembly, 2-Piece Polymer A2-Style Handguards with heat shield and an A2 Flash Hider. title: For Sale:  Lake City, 5.56 NATO, M196 Red Tip Tracer, 55 Grain, 840 Round Ammo Can
postcontent:
Pictures below.

I'm selling 840 tracers in a .50 Cal Ammo Can.  These are very nice and are ready to pick up today - but I only have one can for sale so the first $400 gets them.

Call Greg at 307-253-803six

Here is what Cheaper Than Dirt's site has to say ... 
This is early 80's Lake City red tipped tracer rounds as used by elite forces world wide. The NATO 5.56x45mm, 55 Grain tracer rounds permit visible observation of the bullet's inflight path or trajectory to the point of impact. 
Chamber Pressure: 52,000 psi
Velocity 3200 fps, 15 Feet from Muzzle
Visual illumination begins at 50 yards
10 Rounds per stripper Clip packed in a .50 caliber ammo can for a total of 840 rounds.

Reviews:

NATO M196 Tracers - 12/18/2012
Reviewer: Tracer Man
Good buy for the price of ammo now a days. I liked the fact that the ammo came on stripper clips with bandoliers in a .50 cal ammo can, too. The shipping was fast and the ammo does exactly what it says. It was a great price for the number of tracers that you get and they trace a lot better than the orange tipped tracers like the XM856 American Eagle tracers. Will get more in future if supplies last.

Very Fun!!! - 12/5/2012
Reviewer: 1Gunnut
Great with full auto! 95% light, had to have more!

Satisfied - 12/2/2012
Reviewer: TheDude
4 out of 5 traced. It shoots a little dirty, but it doesn't get any better for plinking. Great ammo for the range.

Now I'm ready!! - 11/30/2012
Reviewer: Gene
Bring on the night time zombies!!! I broke open the can, and after choking on the crisp Nirvana air, I see such a sight I haven't seen since I was doing a live night fire in the Army. Lots of bandoliers of red tipped tracer ammo. After stuffing 100 rounds or so into 30 rd mags (thanks so much for the stripper clips), I was ready to go light up the night sky. After killing several zombie targets, and anything else around worth my lead love note attention, only a few rounds failed to light. Just got to love it, worth every penny. Buy this ammo. Might pick up another can for the apocalypse.

Call Greg at 307-253-803six

title: For Sale:  Springfield National Match 1911 .45 auto commemorative
postcontent:
Springfield Armory Dwight D. Eisenhower 1911 .45 auto.  This was commissioned by the American Historical Society and built by the Springfield custom shop using National Match pistols.  This is a very rare piece.  I've only ever seen number 28 and 76, and mine is number 42.  

The only one I've ever seen for sale was $1,995.  I'm asking $1,500 or best offer, or trade for other firearms.  I'd be intersted in other handguns, rifles or shotguns.

This piece is unfired, however if you chose to shoot it, it would be VERY accurate.  The Springfield National Match pistols, which regular runs were discontinued in 1968, were one of the most accurate factory 1911's ever produced.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Martini Henry Enfield Mark 3 1886
postcontent:
I discovered this rifle while Serving in Afghanistan. I spent my time in between patrols restoring it. The Barrel is clean with its original rifling. I ordered a sling that is original English leather and is over one hundred years old. The Rifle is in great condition. I also have the letter from Bagram Air base in Afghanistan stating that it is an antique rifle and that it was cleared through customs in Afghanistan. This letter will be included with the rifle. 
    Pattern approved in August of 1879, introduced into service March of 1882 in LoC Paragraph 3998
    Small cocking indicator taken from the Carbine models
    Forend no longer attached by a pin going through the wood. Mark IIIs utilize a hook arrangement that hooks into the front of the receiver
    Roman numeral "III" on right side of receiver, below that, the Arabic numeral "1". Same configuration on the buttstock with the manufacturer's roundel
    New, wider breechblock to reduce movement when the block is opened/closed
    Firing pin hole diameter increased .002"

For sale is my Taurus PT1911. A sharp pistol that comes with 2 magazines, the Taurus hard case and an extra set of grips. Want one of the most popular guns in the world? This is an affordable 1911. 

Here is an excerpt from Wikipedia: The PT1911 differs from its many competitors in the 1911-style market in that the basic model offers a package of features found on top-end models from more expensive semi-custom pistol manufacturers such as Springfield Armory, Para-Ordnance, and Kimber Manufacturing at a significantly lower cost.[1]

Featuring a forged steel frame, the PT1911 was originally marketed with a blued carbon steel finish, but as of late 2007 a stainless steel version was released. The standard PT1911 is hand-fit in the Taurus factory and includes popular combat and competition custom features such as a "Beavertail" grip safety with memory groove, extended ambidextrous thumb safety and slide stop controls, lowered and flared ejection port, frame checkering, and other niceties unusual for a pistol of its price range.

title: For Sale:  LED Christmas Light Magic - The Way To Put On Them For The Best Effect!
postcontent:
Product Description :

RRP: $24.95
Your Price: $16.95
(You save $8.00)
SKU: GSLEDSTRING10M_MC
Brand: Green Supply
Condition: New
Weight: 0.50 LBS
Availability: Usually ships within 24 hours.
Shipping: $0.99 (Fixed shipping cost)

Lights on a tree can represent so many fantastic things about the holiday period. The scene 

of a family sitting around a Christmas tree, the only light in the room, while listening to 

the Nutcracker Suite and having hot chocolate. It looks like a fairy tale, but that's what 

the period is about; indulging our winter fantasies through festive decor and customs.

A lot of people choose clear or white bulbs because they match any color scheme or tree 

theme. Colorful lights definitely give a festive look and one colored lights like red or 

blue too go well with certain concepts. LED Christmas lights should be the first thing 

applied to a tree. Before you start to decorate, pull the tree away from the wall or home 

furniture so you can walk entirely around it without obstacle.

How many LED Christmas lights do I need?

A fine estimate of how many LED Christmas lights you'll need is to apply the measurement of 

100 lights for every foot of the tree. So for a 7ft tree, you'll want no fewer than 700 

lights. 100 strand light sets work best for most people. Always plan to pick up an 

additional set of lights in case of shortage or burnout - you would not like to find 

yourself beginning your tree trimming and have to postpone it to run to the shop for more 

lights!

Stringing the LED Christmas lights

Obviously, test the lights before you start. Plug in each strand to make certain every 

thing is a go and have them plugged in as you decorate. It's less complicated to string and 

place them correctly when they're lit. One of the best ways to achieve that "lit from 

inside" tree is to wrap lights around select branches. Start by getting a light controller 

- a multi-socket extension cord. You can buy these at any home improvement or hardware 

store. These holiday hookups allow you to plug multiple strands of lights to one cord and 

control them through one switch. They commonly make them in green but they're also 

accessible in white for white artificial trees. Attach the cord up and down the trunk of 

the tree with twine or pipe cleaner. IMPORTANT: Make certain to read the light 

manufacturer's instructions on strand plug on limits.

Grab a string of lights and start at the top of the tree. Plug the strand into the outlet 

near the top. Starting at the base of a branch, wrap the cord around the branch. Carry on 

until you reach the tip, then wrap back to the the base. You don't have to wrap it super 

tight, just enough to give the branch a sufficient glow without obstructing or crushing the 

individual branches, and simultaneously, hiding the wires well. As you work back toward the 

bottom, you can wrap around a few individual branches top. When you hit the base get 

started with a new branch. You don't need to wrap every single branch either (this would 

take a ton of lights and probably make the tree seem it was on fire rather than beautifully 

lit!). Just make certain you are consistent with your spacing from top to bottom. Take a 

step back and take a look at the tree to see where there might be gaps. It's even easier to 

string with an artificial tree, as you can string as you gather together and position the 

branches. Using this method will give your tree dimension and depth and make it seem like 

it's lit from within!

Take pleasure in your lit tree. Memories are only a light strand away...

title: For Sale:  BRAND NEW BROWNELLS 30-ROUND MAGAZINE AR15 AR-15 M4 MAGAZINES
location: GARNER/CLAYTON, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
VERY LIMITED SUPPLY OF NEW IN PLASTIC MAGS W/ CHROME SILICON SPRING. THE KIND USED BY THE USMC.

A battle rifle is only as reliable as its magazine – make sure the one in your rifle is from Brownells. When the difference between a “bang” and a “click” is life and death, a magazine failure is more than inconvenient – it can be fatal. So when we decided to build our own AR-15/M16 magazines, reliability was our first priority. Some of us have sons and daughters serving overseas or in law enforcement, and we aimed to build the kind of magazine we’d trust their lives with. We started with a clean slate, then worked out the bugs on the drawing board and the test range before we offered a single mag for sale, so you get a magazine of uncompromising quality and reliability that’s built to last and ready to run hard. When failure is not an option, these magazines deliver on the range, in the field, in a tactical situation, under fire. Load these smooth-feeding magazines to maximum capacity and fire the full 30 rounds you expect. No jams, no misfeeds, no hangups.

All components are made of mil-spec materials and are manufactured under strict, ISO quality control standards. The heat-treated, welded aluminum body is hard-anodized for superior corrosion resistance, then given a tough, dry-lube coating to eliminate the need for additional lubricants that would attract dust, sand, or dirt. The latest military-type, glass-fiber reinforced composite follower further guarantees flawless feeding in the harshest tactical conditions. Our new, high lubricity, dry-lube-coated chrome silicon spring that’s corrosion-resistant certified to 500 hour salt spray standards, and less prone to spring “set.” All models are available in standard military Gray.

title: For Sale:  BRAND NEW BROWNELLS 30-ROUND MAGAZINE AR15 AR-15 M4 MAGAZINES
postcontent:
VERY LIMITED SUPPLY OF NEW IN PLASTIC MAGS W/ CHROME SILICON SPRING. THE KIND USED BY THE USMC.

A battle rifle is only as reliable as its magazine – make sure the one in your rifle is from Brownells. When the difference between a “bang” and a “click” is life and death, a magazine failure is more than inconvenient – it can be fatal. So when we decided to build our own AR-15/M16 magazines, reliability was our first priority. Some of us have sons and daughters serving overseas or in law enforcement, and we aimed to build the kind of magazine we’d trust their lives with. We started with a clean slate, then worked out the bugs on the drawing board and the test range before we offered a single mag for sale, so you get a magazine of uncompromising quality and reliability that’s built to last and ready to run hard. When failure is not an option, these magazines deliver on the range, in the field, in a tactical situation, under fire. Load these smooth-feeding magazines to maximum capacity and fire the full 30 rounds you expect. No jams, no misfeeds, no hangups.

All components are made of mil-spec materials and are manufactured under strict, ISO quality control standards. The heat-treated, welded aluminum body is hard-anodized for superior corrosion resistance, then given a tough, dry-lube coating to eliminate the need for additional lubricants that would attract dust, sand, or dirt. The latest military-type, glass-fiber reinforced composite follower further guarantees flawless feeding in the harshest tactical conditions. Our new, high lubricity, dry-lube-coated chrome silicon spring that’s corrosion-resistant certified to 500 hour salt spray standards, and less prone to spring “set.” All models are available in standard military Gray.

title: For Sale:  BRAND NEW BROWNELLS 30-ROUND MAGAZINE AR15 AR-15 M4 MAGAZINES
location: GARNER, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
VERY LIMITED SUPPLY OF NEW IN PLASTIC MAGS W/ CHROME SILICON SPRING. THE KIND USED BY THE USMC.

A battle rifle is only as reliable as its magazine – make sure the one in your rifle is from Brownells. When the difference between a “bang” and a “click” is life and death, a magazine failure is more than inconvenient – it can be fatal. So when we decided to build our own AR-15/M16 magazines, reliability was our first priority. Some of us have sons and daughters serving overseas or in law enforcement, and we aimed to build the kind of magazine we’d trust their lives with. We started with a clean slate, then worked out the bugs on the drawing board and the test range before we offered a single mag for sale, so you get a magazine of uncompromising quality and reliability that’s built to last and ready to run hard. When failure is not an option, these magazines deliver on the range, in the field, in a tactical situation, under fire. Load these smooth-feeding magazines to maximum capacity and fire the full 30 rounds you expect. No jams, no misfeeds, no hangups.

All components are made of mil-spec materials and are manufactured under strict, ISO quality control standards. The heat-treated, welded aluminum body is hard-anodized for superior corrosion resistance, then given a tough, dry-lube coating to eliminate the need for additional lubricants that would attract dust, sand, or dirt. The latest military-type, glass-fiber reinforced composite follower further guarantees flawless feeding in the harshest tactical conditions. Our new, high lubricity, dry-lube-coated chrome silicon spring that’s corrosion-resistant certified to 500 hour salt spray standards, and less prone to spring “set.” All models are available in standard military Gray.

title: For Sale:  Rare (valuable) Yugo RPK-47 - Showroom condition (95-98%) - A 1980's pre-ban import
location: Fuquay Varina, NC, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
FOR SALE:  A near showroom condition (95-98%) very rare and valuable (semi-auto) Yugo RPK-47 military rifle, serial number 002362- manufactured in the 1980's by the Zastavia-Kragujevac Arms Manufacturer, Yugoslavia (very few of these were originally produced).  The value of this rifle is based on several things: 1) It's a "pre-ban" model imported into the US in the 80's by (then) Mitchell Arms out of Santa Ana, Calif, and; 2) It's exceptionally well manufactured to tighter tolerances.  Rifle was maintained by a collector who passed away and was sold to me by his family.  

RIFLE INFORMATION: 

1.  I fired approximately 250 rounds through this rifle to ensure all was OK.  The rifle shoots exceptionally tight - more like a custom-made rifle.  I achieved results of 1 - 1.5 MOA at 100 yards using a Lupold scope.  According to the original owners,  they guestimated that they expended approximately several hundred rounds through this rifle.  Although it has a stamped receiver, the quality level of this rifle is such that it's more in tune with a Milled Receiver - it's that gorgeous of an AK.  All metalwork was superbly crafted and the styling (and quality) of the stock is a cut above other AK's.  Everything about this RPK model speaks volumes about quality craftsmanship.  

2.  As mentioned, the rifle was meticulously maintained.  Because of the rarity of this rifle, it was impossible to find a standard "slip on" AK style of scope rail mount.  So, after a two month nationwide search, I purchased a Russian made (Belarus) quick release mount and had it machine modified by a gunsmith to fit this rare AK (no modifications whatsoever were made to this rifle).  Prior to modifying this Belarus mount, I found (after a nation-wide search) two different original RPK style mounts but because of their extreme rarity (and even though they were in beat-up condition), the sellers still wanted over $600 for each.  Thus, I ordered a Belarus model and had it machine adjusted to fit over the RPK-47 side mount (that's how rare this model is).  

3.  The rifle came with a traditional "slant" style of muzzle compensator.  I had removed that (which will be included in the sale) and I put on a Krinkov style of Compensator (both compensators will be provided at time of sale).

4.  What else is included with this purchase (in addition to the custom machine modified scope rail mentioned above):

a.  I am including the adjustable clamp-on bi-pod that you see in the photos below, 
b.  A new 3-12x44 BSA cats-eye scope which works superbly (scope is new).  
c.  A removable , adjustable cheek riser that you see in the photos.  
d.  Three (3) - 30 round metal magazines are included.
e.  A beautiful (like new) camouflaged carrying case that has pockets for 5 magazines.

WHY AM I SELLING THIS RIFLE:  I'm a retired Marine - in my 60's now and I'm not doing much shooting.  My wife has given me an ultimate of sorting out my collection.  I don't want to sell this RPK-47 because of it's awesome performance, appearance, and quality level - but I'm willing to do so because right now it's just sitting stored in a safe (in a carrying case).  

ASKING PRICE:  $1400 Cash only (no trades).  Note: I paid $1500 for the rifle 3 years ago.  Due to the rarity and quality of this rifle, it is valued at well over $2500 (as of a year ago).  I am willing to part with it for $1400 as long as the buyer will continue to take good care of this beauty.

CONTACT INFORMATION:  I reside in Fuquay Varina, NC, which is 30 minutes south of Raleigh, NC off of highway 401S.  You can either reply to this ad, or you can call me direct on my mobile at REDACTED anytime between 9 AM and 10 PM daily EST (yes, you can call during the Holidays also).  PLEASE, NO TEXTS - just calls, thank you!   

This rifle ad will not last long.

Several photos below

title: For Sale/Trade:   COLLECTOR CUSTOM ELECTRIC GUITAR COBRA SHELBY AUTOGRAPHED JARRETT
postcontent:
This is an extremely rare opportunity to own an unique item. First off, the electric guitar was made by Jarrett Guitars, 50 guitars were scheduled to be built in the limited, but only 40 ended up making the production run. Commemorative Series and this is guitar number #19 in the series, serial number CSX2002-34 . The Guitar comes with certificate of authenticity from JARRETT GUITARS, CONNECTICUT USA. A rare piece both for collectors and players, and an extremely unique piece for Shelby Cobra fans. 22 frets, humbuckers, 3 way selector switch. Volume and tone controls push/pull to split the coils in the humbuckers. Set neck with pearl inlays, and custom Shelby Cobra graphics. If you Google this guitar and read the Harmony Central reviews, you will discover just how amazing this guitar really is. This guitar has lived it's life in it's case which is included. The guitars sold in the 4k-8k range due to the limited number made and have never seen one that was autographed. It was played one time by a professional musician to get feedback on the quality, which as expected, was very impressive to him.

As for the autograph, being a '68 Shelby Cobra GT-500 owner I have attended several events at Boulder Colorado's "Shelby American Collection" museum. Mr. Shelby signed this at one of the annual Christmas benefits (December, 2007) and all monies collected from the benefits were donated to help operate the museum and to the Carroll Shelby Foundation (http://www.cscf.org/). As such it comes with a certificate of authenticity from them. I had Mr. Shelby inscribe it to me and my name can easily be removed with just rubbing alcohol because the inscribed signature was done with a Sharpie and since the guitars finish has several layers of clear coat built up on it, the Sharpie couldn't have penetrated through the finish. I am the original owner of the guitar and have owned it for 7 years. I have rarely come across these guitars and have never seen one that has been autographed. As you know Mr. Shelby has passed away and therefore I wouldn't anticipate a signed example making it to the market..

To get an idea of value's you can check out these current auctions for similar guitars, first ones aren't autographed, second one is but a different type. It's just to give an idea, I don't need any insulting low ball offers, I paid a lot of money just for the opportunity to own this rare guitar...

http://www.ebay.com/itm/TWO-40TH-ANNIVERSARY-SHELBY-COBRA-DAYTONA-GUITARS-CARROLL-SHELBY-NUMBER-ONE-/200856150095?pt=Vintage_Car_Truck_Parts_Accessories&hash=item2ec3f5a04f&vxp=mtr

http://www.ebay.com/itm/Fender-GT500KR-Stratocaster-Signed-By-Carroll-Shelby-GET-IT-FOR-CHRISTMAS-/150963631210?pt=Guitar&hash=item232622346a


I am considering cash offers and trades, things that go boom (H&K, Sig, etc.) bikes, snowmobiles, ATV's, waverunners, boats, cars, jewelry (Rolex), etc., shoot me an email and let me know what you have to offer and I'll get back to you ASAP, thanks in advance..
